page.title: 11Religion
page.content: The building of Macainsh Free Church began in 1856.The Communion Roll is 573. St. Andrew's Church has been in the town since 1853 and was enlarged in 1916.The Communion Roll is 400. St. Patrick's R.C Church has had several locations since 1857, but has been in Station Road since 1877, serving 1,000 people. Lochgelly Baptist Church started about 1901 in the old Co-operative Hall but is now in Station Rd. with a membership of 59. Spiritualist meetings have been held in Lochgelly from pre-1939. Jehovah's Witnesses and the Salvation Army have meeting houses in the town.
